text:
Um, why is this bug report in XalanJ1?  This is most likely a configuration 
issue or Ant issue that should be dealt with on ant-user or the Ant project.

creator: curcuru@apache.org
text:
Since XalanJ1 is no longer officially supported, I'll leave this open merely for historical reasons.
This is a question best asked on the ant-user@jakarta.apache.org list, since it has to do with Ant's support of transformations.  The likely problem is that Ant is somehow trying to use a XalanJ1 transformer when it really wants to use a XalanJ2 transformer - I thought modern Ant builds had already started to default to XalanJ2 (I think the appropriate Ant setting is called 'trax' for the style implementation), but maybe not - or maybe it's the wrong version of optional.jar.
